intro: Amsinckia curvata, commonly known as the curlyhead fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, elongated fruits called achenes, which are dispersed by wind. Amsinckia curvata is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils.
